item.title: Data Science Capstone
item.description:
General Information

Welcome to DATA 510: Data Science Capstone! Over the course of the semester you will designing and completing a large project synthesizing all aspects of the core classes you have taken in this program. Additionally, we will pay particular attention to professional development and job searching skills to aid you in securing future employment.

Syllabus

If you need a quick reference or review, you can find my syllabus here:

Syllabus

item.title: Start of Semester Setup
item.description:
Installing Python

Installing Python

  • Navigate to python.org
  • Mouse over “Downloads” and then choose your OS
  • Download the latest stable version that will work on your system. Anything 3.8 and beyond should be fine for this class.
  • Run the installer. On the first screen, click the bottom box! The the rest of the installation can go with the default options.
  • Once done, you can test that everything went well by trying to launch IDLE.

Installing VSCode

Installing VSCode

item.description:
General Information

Welcome to DATA 351: Data Management with SQL! This is my personal website, and will be the main location where I post things throughout the semester. Anything posted elsewhere will be clearly indicated and announced in class! In general this should be your one-stop-shop for everything class related.

Syllabus

If you need a quick reference or review, you can find my syllabus here:

Syllabus

The Book

We will be using this semester is Practical SQL: A Beginner’s Guide to Storytelling with Data by Anthony DeBarros. The 2nd edition is the most recent version, and definitely has some improvements, but either the 1st or 2nd edition would work well.

import arcade
import random

class Ball:
    def __init__(self, x, y, r):
        self.x = x
        self.y = y
        self.r = r
        self.color = random.choice([arcade.color.YELLOW_ORANGE, arcade.color.APPLE_GREEN])
        self.xdir = random.random()*2
        self.ydir = random.random()*2

    def draw(self):
        arcade.draw_circle_filled(self.x, self.y, self.r, self.color)

    def update(self, width, height):
        self.x += self.xdir
        self.y += self.ydir

        if (self.x + self.r) > width or (self.x - self.r) < 0:
            self.xdir *= -1
        if (self.y + self.r) > height or (self.y - self.r) < 0:
            self.ydir *= -1

    def change_col(self):
        self.color = (random.randint(0,255), random.randint(0,255), random.randint(0,255))



class MyPicture(arcade.Window):
    def __init__(self, width, height, title):
        arcade.Window.__init__(self, width, height, title)
        arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.BLUE)
        
        self.width = width
        self.height = height

        self.balls = [Ball(self.width/2, self.height/2, 10) for i in range(50)]

        self.space_pressed = False

        arcade.run()

    def on_draw(self):
        arcade.start_render()
        for ball in self.balls:
            ball.draw()

    def on_update(self, dt):
        for ball in self.balls:
            ball.update(self.width, self.height)
            if self.space_pressed:
                ball.change_col()

    def on_key_press(self, symbol, modifiers):
        if symbol == arcade.key.SPACE:
            self.space_pressed = True
        elif symbol == arcade.key.Q:
                arcade.close_window()

    def on_key_release(self, key, mod):
        if key == arcade.key.SPACE:
            self.space_pressed = False

import arcade

class Platformer(arcade.Window):
    def __init__(self):
        arcade.Window.__init__(self, 500, 500, 'Arcade Example')
        arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.DARK_LAVA)


        self.player_list = arcade.SpriteList()
        self.terrain_list = arcade.SpriteList()

        self.player_sprite = arcade.Sprite('Sprites/PNG/Characters/platformChar_idle.png', 1)
        self.player_sprite.center_x = 200
        self.player_sprite.center_y = 250
        self.player_list.append(self.player_sprite)

        for loc in [(100,100), (400,200), (200, 400)]:
            terrain = arcade.Sprite('Sprites/PNG/Tiles/platformPack_tile019.png', 1)
            terrain.center_x, terrain.center_y = loc
            self.terrain_list.append(terrain)


        # Add the physics engine. The first input should have been the player SPRITE, not the list
        self.physics = arcade.PhysicsEnginePlatformer(self.player_sprite, self.terrain_list, 0.5)

        # This should always be at the bottom, don't move it up!
        arcade.run()

    def on_draw(self):
        arcade.start_render()

        self.player_list.draw()
        self.terrain_list.draw()

    def on_update(self, dt):
        self.player_list.update() # Updates my movement
        self.physics.update() # Updates the physics engines movement

        # Wrap the screen around both top/bottom and left/right sides
        if self.player_sprite.center_y < -50:
            self.player_sprite.center_y = 600

        if self.player_sprite.center_x < -25:
            self.player_sprite.center_x = 525
        if self.player_sprite.center_x > 525:
            self.player_sprite.center_x = -25

    # change the velocity when a key is pressed
    def on_key_press(self, key, mod):
        if key == arcade.key.RIGHT:
            self.player_sprite.change_x = 2
        elif key == arcade.key.LEFT:
            self.player_sprite.change_x = -2
        elif key == arcade.key.SPACE:
            if self.physics.can_jump():
                self.player_sprite.change_y = 10
        elif key == arcade.key.Q:
            arcade.close_window()

    # When the key is released set the horizontal velocity back to 0
    def on_key_release(self, key, mod):
        if key == arcade.key.RIGHT or key == arcade.key.LEFT:
            self.player_sprite.change_x = 0


Platformer()

import arcade

class Example(arcade.Window):
    def __init__(self, width, height, title):
        arcade.Window.__init__(self, width, height, title)
        arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.BLUE_YONDER)

        self.width = width
        self.height = height

        self.x = self.width/2
        self.y = self.height/2
        self.r = 100
        self.color = arcade.color.BOYSENBERRY
        self.xdir = 1
        self.ydir = 2

        arcade.run()

    def on_draw(self):
        arcade.start_render()
        arcade.draw_circle_filled(self.x, self.y, self.r, self.color)

    def on_update(self, dt):
        self.x += self.xdir
        self.y += self.ydir

        if (self.x+self.r) > self.width or (self.x-self.r)<0:
            self.xdir *= -1
        if (self.y+self.r) > self.height or (self.y-self.r)<0:
            self.ydir *= -1

    def on_key_press(self, key, mod):
        if key == arcade.key.ESCAPE:
            arcade.close_window()
        elif key == arcade.key.SPACE:
            if self.color == arcade.color.BOYSENBERRY:
                self.color = arcade.color.BRIGHT_GREEN
            else:
                self.color = arcade.color.BOYSENBERRY

    def on_mouse_press(self, x, y, button, mod):
        if button == arcade.MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT:
            arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.GUPPIE_GREEN)


Example(500, 500, 'Arcade Example')

class Coordinate:
    def __init__(self,x,y):
        self.x = x
        self.y = y

    def distance(self, other):
        xdiff = (self.x - other.x)
        ydiff = (self.y - other.y)
        dist = (xdiff**2 + ydiff**2)**0.5
        return dist

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'Coordinate({self.x},{self.y})'

    def __str__(self):
        return f'({self.x},{self.y})'

    def __add__(self, other):
        return Coordinate(self.x + other.x, self.y + other.y)

    def __sub__(self, other):
        return Coordinate(self.x - other.x, self.y - other.y)

    def __eq__(self, other):
        return self.x == other.x and self.y == other.y

    def __ne__(self, other):
        return not self == other

A = Coordinate(3,4)
B = Coordinate(1,2)
O = Coordinate(0,0)

print(A)
print(B)
print(A+B)
print(A-B)
print(A==B)
print(A!=B)

import arcade

def main():
    global sprites
    arcade.open_window(500, 300, 'SpriteLists and Animation')
    arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.GREEN_YELLOW)

    truck = arcade.Sprite('pngs/truckcabin.png', 1.5, center_x=250, center_y=150)
    truck.change_x = 1

    hotdogs = arcade.Sprite('pngs/hotdog.png', scale=1.5, center_x=200, center_y=50)
    hotdogs.change_x = 1
    hotdogs.change_y = 1

    iamabus = arcade.Sprite('pngs/bus_school.png', scale=1.5, center_x=100, center_y=200)
    iamabus.change_x, iamabus.change_y = -1, 2

    sprites = arcade.SpriteList()
    sprites.append(truck)
    sprites.append(hotdogs)
    sprites.append(iamabus)

    arcade.schedule(on_draw, 1/60)

    arcade.run()

def on_draw(dt):
    arcade.start_render()

    sprites.draw()
    sprites.update()

    for sprite in sprites:
        if sprite.right > 500 or sprite.left < 0:
            sprite.change_x *= -1
        if sprite.top > 300 or sprite.bottom < 0:
            sprite.change_y *= -1

        if sprite.collides_with_list(sprites):
            sprite.turn_right()

    arcade.finish_render()

main()

import arcade

WIDTH = 600
HEIGHT = 300

def main():
    global bx, by, vx, vy
    arcade.open_window(WIDTH, HEIGHT, 'Example')
    arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.BLUE_SAPPHIRE)
    bx, by = WIDTH/2, HEIGHT/2
    vx, vy = 1, 0.5
    arcade.schedule(on_draw, 1/60)
    arcade.run()

def draw_happy_box(x,y):
    arcade.draw_rectangle_filled(x, y, 50, 50, arcade.color.RED_DEVIL)
    arcade.draw_circle_filled(x+7, y+7, 3, arcade.color.BLACK)
    arcade.draw_circle_filled(x-7, y+7, 3, arcade.color.BLACK)
    arcade.draw_arc_filled(x, y, 20, 10, arcade.color.BLACK, 180, 360)

def on_draw(time_step):
    global bx, by, vx, vy
    arcade.start_render()
    draw_happy_box(bx, by)
    bx += vx
    by += vy
    if bx > WIDTH or bx < 0:
        vx *= -1
    if by > WIDTH or by < 0:
        vy *= -1

main()

goal = 0
epsilon = 0.01
guess = 1
num_guesses = 1

def f(x):
    return 8 * x**2 - 3

while abs(f(guess) - goal) > epsilon:
    numerator = f(guess)
    denom = 16 * guess
    guess -= numerator / denom
    num_guesses += 1
print('Solution:', guess)
print('It took', num_guesses, 'guesses!')

item.title: Hall of Excellence
item.description: This semester I’ll be linking to (with permission) videos that you all have sent in that I think are of particularly high quality. The reason is because I think there is a LOT of be learned from one another when it comes to explaining and thinking about solving physics problems. My plan is to pull one problem from here for each test, so make sure you check out what your peers are submitting! And know that if you make a good submission, it just increases the odds that your question will be the one chosen for the test, which should make that test question pretty easy for you!

        RedChecker.count += 1

    def __del__(self):
        RedChecker.count -= 1

class Pegleg(Pirate):
    def __init__(self, age):
        # This works, but is not the recommended way!
        self.age = age
        self.eyes = 2
        self.legs = 1
        self.type_peg = 'oak'

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'Pegleg({self.age})'

    def __str__(self):
        return 'I have one leg!'

class Patch(Pirate):
    def __init__(self, age):
        Pirate.__init__(self, age)
        self.eyes = 1

class Animal:
    def __init__(self, name, age):
        self.name = name
        self._age = age # Protected
        self.__secret = 'Afraid of water' # Private

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'Animal({self.name}, {self._age})'

    def get_name(self):
        return self.name

    def change_name(self, new_name):
        self.name = new_name

    def get_age(self):
        return self._age

    def set_age(self, new_age):
        self._age = new_age

    def get_secret(self):
        return self.__secret

A = Animal('Barry', 43)
print(A.name) # Can access but not recommended
print(A.get_name()) # Better to use getter
print(A.get_age())
A.set_age(34)
print(A.get_age())
print(A.get_secret()) # Can access this way

def odd_sum(maxnum=10):
    global total
    def add_odd(x):
        global total
        if x % 2 == 1:
            total += x

    total = 0
    for n in range(maxnum+1):
        add_odd(n)
    return total

        return s.upper()
    elif s[-2] == ' ':

    else:

import arcade
import math

def main(size):
    arcade.open_window(size, size, 'TRIANGLES')
    arcade.set_background_color(arcade.color.BLACK)
    arcade.start_render()
    draw_rec_tri(0,0,size)
    arcade.finish_render()
    arcade.run()

def draw_rec_tri(x,y,L):
    if L > 3:
        p1x = x
        p1y = y
        p2x = x+L
        p2y = y
        p3x = x + L * math.cos(60*math.pi/180)
        p3y = y + L * math.sin(60*math.pi/180)
        arcade.draw_triangle_outline(p1x, p1y, p2x, p2y, p3x, p3y, arcade.color.GREEN)

        draw_rec_tri(x, y, L/2)
        draw_rec_tri(x+L/2, y, L/2)
        draw_rec_tri(x + L/2 * math.cos(60*math.pi/180),
            y + L/2 * math.sin(60*math.pi/180), L/2)

main(600)

def wave(x):
    return int(20 * math.sin(x/5) + 20)

def line(x):
    dot_index = wave(x)
    pre = '-'* (dot_index-1)
    return pre + ':)'

    n2_1, n2_2 = cut(name2)

    id1 = random.randint(0,21)
    id2 = random.randint(0,21)

    return name1[:-1], name2.strip()

high = 101

while guess != my_value:
    guess = (low+high)//2
    guess_count += 1
    print('I am guessing:', guess)
    if guess > my_value:
        print('It was too high!')
        high = guess
    elif guess < my_value:
        print('It was too low!')
        low = guess
    else:
        print('I guessed it!')
print('It took me', guess_count, 'guesses!')

while letters[i] != secret_letter:
    i = i + 1

print('Found the secret letter to be:', letters[i])
print('Secret letter actually was:', secret_letter)

    elif dir == 'W' and onpath == 1:
        onpath = 2
    elif dir == 'S' and onpath == 2:

    elif dir == 'W' and onpath == 3:

num1 = 1
while num1 <= 9:

        product = str(num1*num2)
        if len(product) == 1:
            product = ' ' + product
        row = row + ' ' + product
        num2 = num2 + 1
        if num2 > num1:
            break
    print(row)

item.title: Video HW Help
item.description:
General Information

This semester you will commonly have video homework problems assigned on Fridays which will be due the following Monday at midnight. This page is meant to provide some extra guidance and suggestions for how to go about creating these in a simple fashion.

Objectives

The process behind each video homework submission will likely entail the following:

  • Reading the given objective (Posted on the HW pdf)
  • Coming up with a problem that satisfies the objective
  • Solving the problem
  • Making a short (less than 4 minute) video describing your steps to solving the problem
  • Posting your video online
  • Emailing me with a description of your problem and a link to your solution

Video Recommendations

Videos do not need to be Hollywood blockbuster films! It is sufficient for you to write down your solution and then film yourself talking about it. I generally see a few different ways this could be done, and I describe them below.

item.title: Introductory Physics I
item.description:
General Information

Welcome to Willamette’s Physics 221 course! This is my personal website, which I will likely prioritize updating over the WISE pages. This site is prettier anyway…

Syllabus

If you need a quick reference or refresher, my syllabus is below.

<a href="/Website_Backup/class_files/phys221/syllabus.pdf">
	Syllabus
</a>

Homework

Homework in this course is a mix of written and video problems. Written homework will be assigned after each class period and will be due by the end of the next class day. Video homework assignments will be posted on Friday of each week and are due at the end of the following Monday. Problem sets will be posted at the links below.

Homework
% link 2

Guide to Github and Github Classroom

Getting a Github account if you don’t already have one

Getting setup on Github is pretty straightforward:

  1. Navigate you way to www.github.com and click on “Sign Up” in the upper right corner.
  2. You should see a page like below, and can choose your own username, email, and password. These do not need to be affiliated with Willamette accounts if you do not want them to be, but make sure you have access to the email address.
  3. On the next page, choose the free subscription plan.
  4. On this last page, feel free to give Github some info on how you plan to use the account (or just skip this step).
  5. That’s it! You should be able to go ahead and sign in now.

Using Github Classroom

Github classroom has a central hub, located here, where you can see all the current assignments and their deadlines. In general though, this will probably not be a page you need to visit very often.
